Other Protocols.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirecti.name: ComponentRepresentable
Other Protocols.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirecti.abstract: The component representable protocol that comprises what the instruction banner should display.

Enums/VisualInstructionComponentType.htm.name: delimiter
Enums/VisualInstructionComponentType.htm.abstract: The component separates two other destination components.

Enums/VisualInstructionComponentType.htm.name: text
Enums/VisualInstructionComponentType.htm.abstract: The component bears the name of a place or street.

Enums/VisualInstructionComponentType.htm.name: image
Enums/VisualInstructionComponentType.htm.abstract: Component contains an image that should be rendered.

Enums/VisualInstructionComponentType.htm.name: exit
Enums/VisualInstructionComponentType.htm.abstract: The compoment contains the localized word for exit.

Enums/ManeuverDirection.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.name: none
Enums/ManeuverDirection.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.abstract: The step does not have a particular maneuver direction associated with it.

Enums/ManeuverDirection.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.name: sharpRight
Enums/ManeuverDirection.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.abstract: The maneuver requires a sharp turn to the right.

Enums/ManeuverDirection.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.name: right
Enums/ManeuverDirection.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.abstract: The maneuver requires a turn to the right, a merge to the right, or an exit on the right, or the destination is on the right.

Enums/ManeuverDirection.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.name: slightRight
Enums/ManeuverDirection.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.abstract: The maneuver requires a slight turn to the right.

Enums/ManeuverDirection.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.name: straightAhead
Enums/ManeuverDirection.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.abstract: The maneuver requires no notable change in direction, or the destination is straight ahead.

Enums/ManeuverDirection.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.name: slightLeft
Enums/ManeuverDirection.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.abstract: The maneuver requires a slight turn to the left.

Enums/ManeuverDirection.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.name: left
Enums/ManeuverDirection.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.abstract: The maneuver requires a turn to the left, a merge to the left, or an exit on the left, or the destination is on the right.

Enums/ManeuverDirection.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.name: sharpLeft
Enums/ManeuverDirection.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.abstract: The maneuver requires a sharp turn to the left.

Enums/ManeuverDirection.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.name: uTurn
Enums/ManeuverDirection.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.abstract: The maneuver requires a U-turn when possible.

Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: none
Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The step does not have a particular maneuver type associated with it.

Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: depart
Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The step requires the user to depart from a waypoint.

Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: turn
Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The step requires the user to turn.

Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: continue
Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The step requires the user to continue after a turn.

Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: passNameChange
Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The step requires the user to continue on the current road as it changes names.

Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: merge
Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The step requires the user to merge onto another road.

Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: takeOnRamp
Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The step requires the user to take a entrance ramp (slip road) onto a highway.

Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: takeOffRamp
Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The step requires the user to take an exit ramp (slip road) off a highway.

Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: reachFork
Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The step requires the user to choose a fork at a Y-shaped fork in the road.

Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: reachEnd
Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The step requires the user to turn at either a T-shaped three-way intersection or a sharp bend in the road where the road also changes names.

Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: useLane
Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The step requires the user to get into a specific lane in order to continue along the current road.

Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: takeRoundabout
Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The step requires the user to enter and traverse a roundabout (traffic circle or rotary).

Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: takeRotary
Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The step requires the user to enter and traverse a large, named roundabout (traffic circle or rotary).

Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: turnAtRoundabout
Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The step requires the user to enter and exit a roundabout (traffic circle or rotary) that is compact enough to constitute a single intersection.

Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: exitRoundabout
Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The step requires the user to exit a roundabout (traffic circle or rotary).

Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: exitRotary
Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The step requires the user to exit a large, named roundabout (traffic circle or rotary).

Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: heedWarning
Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The step requires the user to respond to a change in travel conditions.

Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: arrive
Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The step requires the user to arrive at a waypoint.

Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: passWaypoint
Enums/ManeuverType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The step requires the user to arrive at an intermediate waypoint.

Enums/TransportType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDir.name: none
Enums/TransportType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDir.abstract: The step does not have a particular transport type associated with it.

Enums/TransportType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDir.name: automobile
Enums/TransportType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDir.abstract: The route requires the user to drive or ride a car, truck, or motorcycle.

Enums/TransportType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDir.name: ferry
Enums/TransportType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDir.abstract: The route requires the user to board a ferry.

Enums/TransportType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDir.name: movableBridge
Enums/TransportType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDir.abstract: The route requires the user to cross a movable bridge.

Enums/TransportType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDir.name: inaccessible
Enums/TransportType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDir.abstract: The route becomes impassable at this point.

Enums/TransportType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDir.name: walking
Enums/TransportType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDir.abstract: The route requires the user to walk.

Enums/TransportType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDir.name: cycling
Enums/TransportType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDir.abstract: The route requires the user to ride a bicycle.

Enums/TransportType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDir.name: train
Enums/TransportType.html#/c:@M@MapboxDir.abstract: The route requires the user to board a train.

Enums/InstructionFormat.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.name: text
Enums/InstructionFormat.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.abstract: The route steps’ instructions are delivered in plain text format.

Enums/InstructionFormat.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.name: html
Enums/InstructionFormat.html#/c:@M@Mapbo.abstract: The route steps’ instructions are delivered in HTML format.

Enums/RouteShapeResolution.html#/c:@M@Ma.name: full
Enums/RouteShapeResolution.html#/c:@M@Ma.abstract: The route’s shape is as detailed as possible.

Enums/RouteShapeFormat.html#/c:@M@Mapbox.name: geoJSON
Enums/RouteShapeFormat.html#/c:@M@Mapbox.abstract: The route’s shape is delivered in GeoJSON format.

Enums/RouteShapeFormat.html#/c:@M@Mapbox.name: polyline
Enums/RouteShapeFormat.html#/c:@M@Mapbox.abstract: The route’s shape is delivered in encoded polyline algorithm format with 1×10−5 precision.

Enums/RouteShapeFormat.html#/c:@M@Mapbox.name: polyline6
Enums/RouteShapeFormat.html#/c:@M@Mapbox.abstract: The route’s shape is delivered in encoded polyline algorithm format with 1×10−6 precision.

Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/c:@M@MapboxD.name: unknown
Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/c:@M@MapboxD.abstract: There is not enough data to determine the level of congestion along the road segment.

Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/c:@M@MapboxD.name: low
Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/c:@M@MapboxD.abstract: The road segment has little or no congestion. Traffic is flowing smoothly.

Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/c:@M@MapboxD.name: moderate
Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/c:@M@MapboxD.abstract: The road segment has moderate, stop-and-go congestion. Traffic is flowing but speed is impeded.

Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/c:@M@MapboxD.name: heavy
Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/c:@M@MapboxD.abstract: The road segment has heavy, bumper-to-bumper congestion. Traffic is barely moving.

Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/c:@M@MapboxD.name: severe
Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/c:@M@MapboxD.abstract: The road segment has severe congestion. Traffic may be completely stopped.

Enums/CongestionLevel.html.name: CongestionLevel
Enums/CongestionLevel.html.abstract: A CongestionLevel indicates the level of traffic congestion along a road segment relative to the normal flow of traffic along that segment. You can color-code a route line according to the congestion level along each segment of the route.

Enums/RouteShapeFormat.html.name: RouteShapeFormat
Enums/RouteShapeFormat.html.abstract: A RouteShapeFormat indicates the format of a route or match shape in the raw HTTP response.

Enums/RouteShapeResolution.html.name: RouteShapeResolution
Enums/RouteShapeResolution.html.abstract: A RouteShapeResolution indicates the level of detail in a route’s shape, or whether the shape is present at all.

Enums/MeasurementSystem.html.name: MeasurementSystem
Enums/MeasurementSystem.html.abstract: A system of units of measuring distances and other quantities.

Enums/InstructionFormat.html.name: InstructionFormat
Enums/InstructionFormat.html.abstract: A RouteShapeFormat indicates the format of a route’s shape in the raw HTTP response.

Enums/TransportType.html.name: TransportType
Enums/TransportType.html.abstract: A TransportType specifies the mode of transportation used for part of a route.

Enums/ManeuverType.html.name: ManeuverType
Enums/ManeuverType.html.abstract: A ManeuverType specifies the type of maneuver required to complete the route step. You can pair a maneuver type with a ManeuverDirection to choose an appropriate visual or voice prompt to present the user.

Enums/ManeuverDirection.html.name: ManeuverDirection
Enums/ManeuverDirection.html.abstract: A ManeuverDirection clarifies a ManeuverType with directional information. The exact meaning of the maneuver direction for a given step depends on the step’s maneuver type; see the ManeuverType documentation for details.

Enums/DrivingSide.html.name: DrivingSide
Enums/DrivingSide.html.abstract: A DrivingSide indicates which side of the road cars and traffic flow.

Other Global Variables.html#/s:16MapboxD.name: MBDirectionsErrorDomain
Other Global Variables.html#/s:16MapboxD.abstract: Indicates that an error occurred in MapboxDirections.

Classes/VisualInstructionComponent.html#.name: imageURL
Classes/VisualInstructionComponent.html#.abstract: The URL to an image representation of this component.

Classes/VisualInstructionComponent.html#.name: abbreviationPriority
Classes/VisualInstructionComponent.html#.abstract: The priority for which the component should be abbreviated.

Classes/VisualInstructionComponent.html#.name: text
Classes/VisualInstructionComponent.html#.abstract: The plain text representation of this component.

Classes/VisualInstructionComponent.html#.name: type
Classes/VisualInstructionComponent.html#.abstract: The type of visual instruction component. You can display the component differently depending on its type.

Classes/VisualInstructionComponent.html#.name: init(json:)
Classes/VisualInstructionComponent.html#.abstract: Initializes a new visual instruction component object based on the given JSON dictionary representation.

Classes/VisualInstructionComponent.html#.name: init(type:text:imageURL:abbreviation:abbreviationPriority:)
Classes/VisualInstructionComponent.html#.abstract: Initializes a new visual instruction component object that displays the given information.

Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/c:.name: distanceAlongStep
Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/c:.abstract: The distance at which the visual instruction should be shown, measured in meters from the beginning of the step.

Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/c:.name: primaryInstruction
Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/c:.abstract: The most important information to convey to the user about the RouteStep.

Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/c:.name: tertiaryInstruction
Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/c:.abstract: A visual instruction that is presented simultaneously to provide information about an additional maneuver that occurs in rapid succession.

Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/c:.name: drivingSide
Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/c:.abstract: Which side of a bidirectional road the driver should drive on, also known as the rule of the road.

Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/c:.name: init(json:drivingSide:)
Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/c:.abstract: Initializes a new visual instruction banner object based on the given JSON dictionary representation and a driving side.

Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/c:.name: init(distanceAlongStep:primaryInstruction:secondaryInstruction:tertiaryInstruction:drivingSide:)
Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/c:.abstract: Initializes a new visual instruction banner object that displays the given information.

Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.name: text
Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: A plain text representation of the instruction.

Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.name: maneuverType
Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: The type of maneuver required for beginning the step described by the visual instruction.

Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.name: maneuverDirection
Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: Additional directional information to clarify the maneuver type.

Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.name: finalHeading
Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: The heading at which the user exits a roundabout (traffic circle or rotary).

Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.name: init(text:maneuverType:maneuverDirection:components:degrees:)
Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: Initializes a new visual instruction banner object that displays the given information.

Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.name: init(json:)
Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: Initializes a new visual instruction object based on the given JSON dictionary representation.

Classes/SpokenInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.name: distanceAlongStep
Classes/SpokenInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: A distance along the associated RouteStep at which to read the instruction aloud.

Classes/SpokenInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.name: text
Classes/SpokenInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: A plain-text representation of the speech-optimized instruction.

Classes/SpokenInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.name: ssmlText
Classes/SpokenInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: A formatted representation of the speech-optimized instruction.

Classes/SpokenInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.name: init(json:)
Classes/SpokenInstruction.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: Initializes a new spoken instruction object based on the given JSON dictionary representation.

Classes/RouteOptionsV4.html#/c:@M@Mapbox.name: instructionFormat
Classes/RouteOptionsV4.html#/c:@M@Mapbox.abstract: The format of the returned route steps’ instructions.

Classes/RouteOptionsV4.html#/c:@M@Mapbox.name: includesShapes
Classes/RouteOptionsV4.html#/c:@M@Mapbox.abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether the returned routes and their route steps should include any geographic coordinate data.

Classes/LaneIndicationComponent.html#/c:.name: indications
Classes/LaneIndicationComponent.html#/c:.abstract: An array indicating which directions you can go from a lane (left, right, or straight).

Classes/LaneIndicationComponent.html#/c:.name: isUsable
Classes/LaneIndicationComponent.html#/c:.abstract: The boolean that indicates whether the lane can be used to complete the maneuver.

Classes/LaneIndicationComponent.html#/c:.name: init(indications:isUsable:)
Classes/LaneIndicationComponent.html#/c:.abstract: Initializes a new visual instruction component object that displays the given information.

Classes/Lane.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirections.name: indications
Classes/Lane.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirections.abstract: The lane indications specifying the maneuvers that may be executed from the lane.

Classes/Lane.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirections.name: init(indications:)
Classes/Lane.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirections.abstract: Initializes a new Lane using the given lane indications.

Classes/Intersection.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.name: location
Classes/Intersection.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.abstract: The geographic coordinates at the center of the intersection.

Classes/Intersection.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.name: headings
Classes/Intersection.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.abstract: An array of CLLocationDirections indicating the absolute headings of the roads that meet at the intersection.

Classes/Intersection.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.name: outletIndexes
Classes/Intersection.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.abstract: The indices of the items in the headings array that correspond to the roads that may be used to leave the intersection.

Classes/Intersection.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.name: approachIndex
Classes/Intersection.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.abstract: The index of the item in the headings array that corresponds to the road that the containing route step uses to approach the intersection.

Classes/Intersection.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.name: outletIndex
Classes/Intersection.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.abstract: The index of the item in the headings array that corresponds to the road that the containing route step uses to leave the intersection.

Classes/Intersection.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.name: approachLanes
Classes/Intersection.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.abstract: An array of Lane objects representing all the lanes of the road that the containing route step uses to approach the intersection.

Classes/Intersection.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.name: usableApproachLanes
Classes/Intersection.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.abstract: The indices of the items in the approachLanes array that correspond to the roads that may be used to execute the maneuver.

Classes/Intersection.html#/s:16MapboxDir.name: outletRoadClasses
Classes/Intersection.html#/s:16MapboxDir.abstract: The road classes of the road that the containing step uses to leave the intersection.

Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/c:@M@Mapb.name: coordinates
Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/c:@M@Mapb.abstract: An array of geographic coordinates defining the path of the route from start to finish.

Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/c:@M@Mapb.name: legs
Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/c:@M@Mapb.abstract: An array of RouteLeg objects representing the legs of the route.

Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/c:@M@Mapb.name: expectedTravelTime
Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/c:@M@Mapb.abstract: The route’s expected travel time, measured in seconds.

Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/c:@M@Mapb.name: directionsOptions
Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/c:@M@Mapb.abstract: RouteOptions used to create the directions request.

Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/c:@M@Mapb.name: accessToken
Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/c:@M@Mapb.abstract: The access token used to make the directions request.

Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/c:@M@Mapb.name: apiEndpoint
Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/c:@M@Mapb.abstract: The endpoint used to make the directions request.

Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/c:@M@Mapb.name: routeIdentifier
Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/c:@M@Mapb.abstract: A unique identifier for a directions request.

Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/c:@M@Mapb.name: speechLocale
Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/c:@M@Mapb.abstract: The locale to use for spoken instructions.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.name: init(waypoints:profileIdentifier:)
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: Initializes an options object for routes between the given waypoints and an optional profile identifier.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.name: waypoints
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: An array of Waypoint objects representing locations that the route should visit in chronological order.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.name: profileIdentifier
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: A string specifying the primary mode of transportation for the routes.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.name: includesSteps
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether MBRouteStep objects should be included in the response.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.name: shapeFormat
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: Format of the data from which the shapes of the returned route and its steps are derived.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.name: routeShapeResolution
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: Resolution of the shape of the returned route.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.name: attributeOptions
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: AttributeOptions for the route. Any combination of AttributeOptions can be specified.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.name: locale
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: The locale in which the route’s instructions are written.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.name: includesSpokenInstructions
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether each route step includes an array of SpokenInstructions.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.name: distanceMeasurementSystem
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: The measurement system used in spoken instructions included in route steps.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.name: includesVisualInstructions
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/c:@M@Map.abstract: If true, each RouteStep will contain the property visualInstructionsAlongStep.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html.name: DirectionsOptions
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html.abstract: Options for calculating results from the Mapbox Directions service.

Classes/DirectionsResult.html.name: DirectionsResult
Classes/DirectionsResult.html.abstract: A DirectionsResult represents a result returned from either the Mapbox Directions service.

Classes/Intersection.html.name: Intersection
Classes/Intersection.html.abstract: A single cross street along a step.

Classes/Lane.html.name: Lane
Classes/Lane.html.abstract: A lane on the road approaching an intersection.

Classes/LaneIndicationComponent.html.name: LaneIndicationComponent
Classes/LaneIndicationComponent.html.abstract: A component that represents a lane representation of an instruction.

Classes/RouteOptionsV4.html.name: RouteOptionsV4
Classes/RouteOptionsV4.html.abstract: A RouteOptionsV4 object is a structure that specifies the criteria for results returned by the Mapbox Directions API v4.

Classes/SpokenInstruction.html.name: SpokenInstruction
Classes/SpokenInstruction.html.abstract: An instruction about an upcoming RouteStep’s maneuver, optimized for speech synthesis.

Classes/VisualInstruction.html.name: VisualInstruction
Classes/VisualInstruction.html.abstract: The contents of a banner that should be displayed as added visual guidance for a route. The banner instructions are children of the steps during which they should be displayed, but they refer to the maneuver in the following step.

Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html.name: VisualInstructionBanner
Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html.abstract: A visual instruction banner contains all the information necessary for creating a visual cue about a given RouteStep.

Classes/VisualInstructionComponent.html.name: VisualInstructionComponent
Classes/VisualInstructionComponent.html.abstract: A component of a VisualInstruction that represents a single run of similarly formatted text or an image with a textual fallback representation.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: init(json:options:)
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: Initializes a new route step object based on the given JSON dictionary representation.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: coordinates
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: An array of geographic coordinates defining the path of the route step from the location of the maneuver to the location of the next step’s maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: coordinateCount
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: The number of coordinates.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: getCoordinates(_:)
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: Retrieves the coordinates.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: instructions
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: A string with instructions explaining how to perform the step’s maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: instructionsSpokenAlongStep
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: Instructions about the next step’s maneuver, optimized for speech synthesis.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: instructionsDisplayedAlongStep
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: Instructions about the next step’s maneuver, optimized for display in real time.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: initialHeading
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: The user’s heading immediately before performing the maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: finalHeading
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: The user’s heading immediately after performing the maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: maneuverType
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: The type of maneuver required for beginning this step.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: maneuverDirection
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: Additional directional information to clarify the maneuver type.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: drivingSide
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: Which side of a bidirectional road the driver should drive on, also known as the rule of the road.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: maneuverLocation
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: The location of the maneuver at the beginning of this step.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: exitIndex
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: The number of exits from the previous maneuver up to and including this step’s maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: exitCodes
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: Any exit numbers assigned to the highway exit at the maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: exitNames
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: The names of the roundabout exit.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: phoneticExitNames
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: A phonetic or phonemic transcription indicating how to pronounce the names in the exitNames property.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: distance
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: The step’s distance, measured in meters.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: expectedTravelTime
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: The step’s expected travel time, measured in seconds.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: names
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: The names of the road or path leading from this step’s maneuver to the next step’s maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: phoneticNames
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: A phonetic or phonemic transcription indicating how to pronounce the names in the names property.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: codes
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: Any route reference codes assigned to the road or path leading from this step’s maneuver to the next step’s maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: transportType
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: The mode of transportation used for the step.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: destinationCodes
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: Any route reference codes that appear on guide signage for the road leading from this step’s maneuver to the next step’s maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: destinations
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: Destinations, such as control cities, that appear on guide signage for the road leading from this step’s maneuver to the next step’s maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.name: intersections
Classes/RouteStep.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirec.abstract: An array of intersections along the step.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.name: init(json:source:destination:options:)
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.abstract: Initializes a new route leg object with the given JSON dictionary representation and waypoints.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.name: source
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.abstract: The starting point of the route leg.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.name: steps
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.abstract: An array of one or more RouteStep objects representing the steps for traversing this leg of the route.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.name: segmentDistances
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.abstract: An array containing the distance (measured in meters) between each coordinate in the route leg geometry.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.name: expectedSegmentTravelTimes
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.abstract: An array containing the expected travel time (measured in seconds) between each coordinate in the route leg geometry.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.name: segmentSpeeds
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.abstract: An array containing the expected average speed (measured in meters per second) between each coordinate in the route leg geometry.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: segmentCongestionLevels
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: An array containing the traffic congestion level along each road segment in the route leg geometry.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.name: name
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.abstract: A name that describes the route leg.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.name: distance
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.abstract: The route leg’s distance, measured in meters.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.name: expectedTravelTime
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.abstract: The route leg’s expected travel time, measured in seconds.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.name: profileIdentifier
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.abstract: A string specifying the primary mode of transportation for the route leg.

Classes/Route.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirection.name: init(json:waypoints:options:)
Classes/Route.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirection.abstract: Initializes a new route object with the given JSON dictionary representation and waypoints.

Classes/Route.html.name: Route
Classes/Route.html.abstract: A Route object defines a single route that the user can follow to visit a series of waypoints in order. The route object includes information about the route, such as its distance and expected travel time. Depending on the criteria used to calculate the route, the route object may also include detailed turn-by-turn instructions.

Classes/RouteLeg.html.name: RouteLeg
Classes/RouteLeg.html.abstract: A RouteLeg object defines a single leg of a route between two waypoints. If the overall route has only two waypoints, it has a single RouteLeg object that covers the entire route. The route leg object includes information about the leg, such as its name, distance, and expected travel time. Depending on the criteria used to calculate the route, the route leg object may also include detailed turn-by-turn instructions.

Classes/RouteStep.html.name: RouteStep
Classes/RouteStep.html.abstract: A RouteStep object represents a single distinct maneuver along a route and the approach to the next maneuver. The route step object corresponds to a single instruction the user must follow to complete a portion of the route. For example, a step might require the user to turn then follow a road.

Classes/Match.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirection.name: init(json:tracepoints:waypointIndices:matchOptions:)
Classes/Match.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirection.abstract: Initializes a new match object with the given JSON dictionary representation and tracepoints.

Classes/Match.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirection.name: confidence
Classes/Match.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirection.abstract: A number between 0 and 1 that indicates the Map Matching API’s confidence that the match is accurate. A higher confidence means the match is more likely to be accurate.

Classes/Match.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirection.name: tracepoints
Classes/Match.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirection.abstract: Tracepoints on the road network that match the tracepoints in the match options.

Classes/Match.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirection.name: waypointIndices
Classes/Match.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirection.abstract: Index of the waypoint inside the matched route.

Classes/Match.html#/s:16MapboxDirections.name: matchOptions
Classes/Match.html#/s:16MapboxDirections.abstract: MatchOptions used to create the match request.

Classes/Tracepoint.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: alternateCount
Classes/Tracepoint.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: Number of probable alternative matchings for this tracepoint. A value of zero indicates that this point was matched unambiguously.

Classes/MatchOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.name: init(locations:profileIdentifier:)
Classes/MatchOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.abstract: Initializes a match options object for matching locations against the road network.

Classes/MatchOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.name: init(coordinates:profileIdentifier:)
Classes/MatchOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.abstract: Initializes a match options object for matching geographic coordinates against the road network.

Classes/MatchOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.name: resamplesTraces
Classes/MatchOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.abstract: If true, the input locations are re-sampled for improved map matching results. The default is false.

Classes/MatchOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.name: waypointIndices
Classes/MatchOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.abstract: An index set containing indices of two or more items in coordinates. These will be represented by Waypoints in the resulting Match objects.

Classes/MatchOptions.html.name: MatchOptions
Classes/MatchOptions.html.abstract: A MatchOptions object is a structure that specifies the criteria for results returned by the Mapbox Map Matching API.

Classes/Tracepoint.html.name: Tracepoint
Classes/Tracepoint.html.abstract: A Tracepoint represents a location matched to the road network.

Classes/Match.html.name: Match
Classes/Match.html.abstract: A Match object defines a single route that was created from a series of points that were matched against a road network.

Classes/Waypoint.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.name: init(coordinate:coordinateAccuracy:name:)
Classes/Waypoint.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.abstract: Initializes a new waypoint object with the given geographic coordinate and an optional accuracy and name.

Classes/Waypoint.html#/init(location:hea.name: init(location:heading:name:)
Classes/Waypoint.html#/init(location:hea.abstract: Initializes a new waypoint object with the given CLLocation object and an optional heading value and name.

Classes/Waypoint.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.name: init(location:heading:name:)
Classes/Waypoint.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.abstract: Initializes a new waypoint object with the given CLLocation object and an optional CLHeading object and name.

Classes/Waypoint.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.name: coordinateAccuracy
Classes/Waypoint.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.abstract: The radius of uncertainty for the waypoint, measured in meters.

Classes/Waypoint.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.name: heading
Classes/Waypoint.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.abstract: The direction from which a route must approach this waypoint in order to be considered viable.

Classes/Waypoint.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.name: headingAccuracy
Classes/Waypoint.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.abstract: The maximum amount, in degrees, by which a route’s approach to a waypoint may differ from heading in either direction in order to be considered viable.

Classes/Waypoint.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.name: allowsArrivingOnOppositeSide
Classes/Waypoint.html#/c:@M@MapboxDirect.abstract: A boolean value indicating whether arriving on opposite side is allowed.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.name: init(locations:profileIdentifier:)
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.abstract: Initializes a route options object for routes between the given locations and an optional profile identifier.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.name: init(coordinates:profileIdentifier:)
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.abstract: Initializes a route options object for routes between the given geographic coordinates and an optional profile identifier.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.name: init(waypoints:profileIdentifier:)
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.abstract: Initializes a route options object for routes between the given waypoints and an optional profile identifier.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.name: allowsUTurnAtWaypoint
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.abstract: A Boolean value that indicates whether a returned route may require a point U-turn at an intermediate waypoint.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.name: includesAlternativeRoutes
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether alternative routes should be included in the response.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.name: includesExitRoundaboutManeuver
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether the route includes a ManeuverType.exitRoundabout or ManeuverType.exitRotary step when traversing a roundabout or rotary, respectively.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.name: roadClassesToAvoid
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDi.abstract: The route classes that the calculated routes will avoid.

Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: RouteCompletionHandler
Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: A closure (block) to be called when a directions request is complete.

Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: MatchCompletionHandler
Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: A closure (block) to be called when a map matching request is complete.

Classes/Directions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: init(accessToken:host:)
Classes/Directions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: Initializes a newly created directions object with an optional access token and host.

Classes/Directions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: init(accessToken:)
Classes/Directions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: Initializes a newly created directions object with an optional access token.

Classes/Directions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: calculate(_:completionHandler:)
Classes/Directions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: Begins asynchronously calculating the route or routes using the given options and delivers the results to a closure.

Classes/Directions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: calculate(_:completionHandler:)
Classes/Directions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: Begins asynchronously calculating a match using the given options and delivers the results to a closure.

Classes/Directions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.name: url(forCalculating:)
Classes/Directions.html#/c:@M@MapboxDire.abstract: The HTTP URL used to fetch the routes from the API.

Classes/Directions.html.name: Directions
Classes/Directions.html.abstract: A Directions object provides you with optimal directions between different locations, or waypoints. The directions object passes your request to the Mapbox Directions API and returns the requested information to a closure (block) that you provide. A directions object can handle multiple simultaneous requests. A RouteOptions object specifies criteria for the results, such as intermediate waypoints, a mode of transportation, or the level of detail to be returned.

Classes/RouteOptions.html.name: RouteOptions
Classes/RouteOptions.html.abstract: A RouteOptions object is a structure that specifies the criteria for results returned by the Mapbox Directions API.

Classes/Waypoint.html.name: Waypoint
Classes/Waypoint.html.abstract: A Waypoint object indicates a location along a route. It may be the route’s origin or destination, or it may be another location that the route visits. A waypoint object indicates the location’s geographic location along with other optional information, such as a name or the user’s direction approaching the waypoint. You create a RouteOptions object using waypoint objects and also receive waypoint objects in the completion handler of the Directions.calculate(_:completionHandler:) method.

Other Global Variables.html.name: Other Global Variables
Other Global Variables.html.abstract: The following global variables are available globally.
